result.execSummary:
The defendant Chasity A Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes:
The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.
  Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow all recommendations.

Not to associate with any known drug users or those involved in trafficking, other than in a professional group counseling setting or meeting.
  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

supervisions.notes: If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes: Payment plan $100 per month beginning one month after release from jail.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.
  Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow all recommendations. Assessment is to be completed within 30 days of release from jail.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  Not to associate with any known drug users or those involved in trafficking, other than in a professional group counseling setting or meeting.
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  Any contraband seized to be forfeited!

Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended. Assessment is to be completed within 30 days of release from jail.

15CF189 and 14CF237 - Defendant Chasity A Miller in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ct notes also a case 15CF208 that was read in and dismissed as part of the agreerment in this case.  Miller may have been confused of time req to appear for sentencing, did not appear in timely matter for sentencing scheduled 02-01-17 a warrant issued - and she then turned herself in and court cancels warrants and vacates forfeiture of bail order.  Pre-sentence was prepared.  Ct - 14CF237 - if conviction on Count 5 is indeed for poss with intent to deliver or poss - 2nd offense? - DA - condition is for possess of THC - 2nd offense.  Discussion about PSI - first page -penalty right - once in PSI mentions 6 month enhancer; and also note possess with intent - 2nd or sub offense in  CCAP needs to correct this as well,  Ct - straight forward Possession of THC - 2nd Offense, contrary to Sec. 961.41(3g)(e) and second, a Class I Felony.   JOC should be noted for the correct offense and and CCAP entries for what she is convicted of should be amended.  When Ct reviewed complaint - complaint did allege possess within intent to deliver, and pursuant to agreement of parties amended to possess of THC - 2nd Offense.    DA  - any other comments, just what she was convicted of on page 5, 6 and 7, and prior record.  SPD - comments of pre-sentence - nothing other than was DA mentioned.  DA comments about sentencing.    22 prior convictions - 4 felony convictions including the 2 felony convictions being sentenced today.  Placed on probation 3 times and all 3 times probation resulted in revocation.  Adopts the recommendations of the PSI.  Ct questions SPD - page 14 - has not been in any type of treatment? -     SPD states that is correct.  Ct questions defendant - no one any discussed treatment.  SPD comments about sentencing.  Currently resides in Ironwood with Anthony Marsh. Concur with recommendations.  As of today 17 days CTS.  Ask to serve time in Gogebic County if can be. child are release priv.  MH assmt.   Defendant comments about sentencing.  Court comments about sentencing  SENTENCE:    14CF237 -  each count - sentence withheld prob 2 years - 15CF189 - sentence to WS for 36 mo 18 mo ic 18 mo es - sent imposed and stayed, probation 3 years.  If prob revoked and goes to prsion elig for substance abuse treatmt program.  Conditions of Ext Sup - AODA FT - MAS - MH Assmt FT - no contact with known drug users except group treatment, other counseling by DOC.  Conditions of probation on all counts - 14CF237  - count 5 - 6 months ACJ - 180 days.  CTS 17 days - wr cc release - serving time somewhere else - if can be assured going directly from ACJ to GCJ would go along with that but when two convictions already for FTR and has 2 conv for BJ - not a good rish to trust to do things on own, may serve time in GCJ or ICSD if make necessary arrrangm't between sheriff's depart if no cost to ACJ and if she needs a furlough may be problematic.  AODA FT; Assm't conducted within 30 days  frm rlease from jail, MH - FT; conducted with 30 days release from jail; MAS - do not consum possess mind altering substance,  do not poss drug para, do not be present where MAS are being consumed, no contact with known drug or traffick expcept in contest of correctional setting or group treatment. other counseling as directed by DOC, random testing; mandatory court costs 10 fine plus costs each count 577.55 on the THC; 488.88 on the obstructing; and 567.63 on the BJ -   all to be paid thru the COC office. PP - once released from jail 100/mo starting 30 days from release.  As a conv felony no gun, no vote.  Encourage that Ms. Miller not be moved until she received a written copy of the JOC.   Any contraband seized ordered forfeited.  - money that was seized - need to have a hearing where two can work out whose money it is.  State brought no forfeiture action so something that can eventually be returned.  Hearing set up now, Ms. Decorah needs notice of the hearing.  SPD  - not sure - if return of property not sure can represent.  March 2, 2017 at 2:30 - court to send out notices - 45 minutes.   DA - will not particpate in - state consents to money being returned, and court needs to determine who gets it.  Miller - parties stipulate? between her and Ms. Decorah.  - Count 5 - no good time.  Start jail time today.
Bail Bond Forfeiture Vacated as order of the Court.

Defendant Chasity A Miller in court via phone  Saux Co jail with attorney Mark L Perrine in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF237,15CF189,15CF208. Atty states def waives rights to prelim in case 189 and 208. understands rights. no threat or force. Gives up right to prelim Ct finds probable cause the Def committed a fel in Ashland Co. Info's filed.  Do argn now. Atty and def will talk about property seized in the case with a co def. waives reading and stands mute to both charges. NG is now entered for her in each ct. Def is not asking for a speedy trial. did file motion for bail modifaction. Cash bail is set at $500 and because that is set they will not do huber priv. propsal for $200 cash and $3000 sign. ST does oppose this. Ct orders temp modify bail to a $3000 sign and all other conditions stay the same. Ct will go back to $500 by Sept 1, 2016. All none monitary conditions remain. Clerk set up to appear by phone.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 01:10 pm.
